intro: Freycinetia vieillardii, commonly known as the Red-veined Screw-pine, is a tropical plant native to the Indo-Pacific region. It is a flowering plant in the family Pandanaceae, characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are often used in traditional crafts and as a source of fiber. The species is adapted to coastal and saline environments, making it a hardy ornamental plant.
